content:
Hi All,
I want to find the git code for that project http://build.fhir.org/ .
from where I can find that if anybody knows please ping me.
The FHIR spec is currently hosted in SVN here: https://gforge.hl7.org/svn/fhir/trunk/build
If you're interested in running the build locally, instructions are here: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Build_Process
Note that if you modify or add resources, any implementation that relies on those changes will not be FHIR compliant.
I am interested in running the build locally.I registered my account,how much time will be taken to activate my account.

You can get read-only access using anonymous as the userid and leaving the password blank. (You won't get approved as an authorized committer unless you're doing work on behalf of a workgroup.) Sorry for failing to mention that bit previously.

@Grahame Grieve
I want to see the flowing of the code of http://build.fhir.org/ .
Lloyd Mckenzie send me some link but when I am running this code then nothing will be showing after running the IG.
so if you have any idea about that code then ping me.
Thanks
I'm not sure from what you say, what the problem is. You run the main build, to build FHIR itself? that won't produce an IG
Ok I got it but where I can find the main build
publish.bat in the \build. but you should read the instructions
